title: How to Discover Where, Why, and When, Hidden and Secret Spy Cameras are Watching You...
text: How to Discover Where, Why, and When, Hidden and Secret Spy Cameras are Watching You... October 19, 2015 -- A unique E-Guide designed for mobile device users of iPads, iPhones, smartphones, tablets, and laptops, is offered for immediate downloading by 21st Century Research. Sarasota, FL, USA - October 19, 2015 - "How to Spot Spy Cameras Watching You" E-Guide was researched and compiled by Florida author Bohdan O. Szuprowicz who publishes numerous E-Books on Amazon Kindle. You can download full details of this E-Guide using the link below: http://www.amazon.com/ebook/dp/B00P04QA9G This E-Guide consists of 30 chapters focusing on public attitudes toward surveillance, state of development and future projects, and numerous discussions of specific spy camera usage in various walks of life. Hidden and concealed camera technology has advanced rapidly to the point where anyone in public or private areas may be followed in real-time by invisible spy cameras. Wireless capabilities of these devices can record and transmit such video-recordings to anywhere in the world.The media these days are full of images and videos of people whose activities were captured by cameras, often without their knowledge or consent. This E-Guide is designed to describe the many video systems and typical locations where average persons are exposed almost anytime, day or night, whether they like it or not.The media increasingly report confrontations between various authorities and innocent public based on cameras used by one or both sides. Most public institutions and businesses are equipped with so-called "security" cameras. It is high time that individuals also incorporate such devices when they are outside their homes or travel abroad.Miniature cameras can be concealed on a person in form of eyeglasses, hearing aids, tie clips, watches, badges, buttons, and jewelry. In households cameras may be hidden in clocks, TVs, radios, mirrors, picture frames, and other common objects. Both hidden and visible surveillance cameras are installed in many shopping malls, supermarkets, meeting halls, schools, churches, government offices, hospitals, airports, bus and railway stations, highways, toll gates, truck stops, cruise ships, casinos, theaters, cinemas, libraries and museums. The E-Guide also describes spy camera detectors that can be used to identify the existence and operation of hidden cameras. Some can also be used to counteract their operation making them ineffective. It shows the reader how to discover, avoid, or exploit, spy cameras that are following all of us around wherever we move, day or night. Whether or not you operate a mobile camera, secret or overt currently, this E-Guide is designed as an App to provide anyone with basic information about how spy cameras are watching us and what we can do about it.Concealed spy camera detectors are also being offered on the market. These are devices which give you an opportunity to find out if you are under camera surveillance. They can be particularly useful in public places and hotels and motels for "debugging" the facilities.Within each chapter there are links to various web sites that describe the use of spy cameras in specific operations and where to look for them. Other links provide a means of reaching vendors of spy cameras and detection devices. These are useful in providing examples of what to look for as well as an orientation about prices and availability of various spy camera products.The E-Guide is truly an invaluable App in any mobile device always ready to advise any person who is active in public areas. Synopsis: Hidden and secret spy cameras are here to stay and their use multiplies exponentially throughout the world. Anyone moving in public places or unfamiliar meeting halls or even households, should be aware that his movements may be video recorded and sent to third parties without their consent. The E-Guide also alerts you to the existence of spy camera detectors that can alert you to where they are in operation. What Readers Are Saying: It's shocking. A must read for everybody Fascinating, interesting and a must-read if you can stomach it. This short booklet contains more information than I wanted to know, yet - absolutely fascinating. While I was aware of much of the content (I tend to be overcautious) I was absolutely shocked to find out that people get spied on in their hotel rooms. Naturally, casinos, stores with expensive merchandise, etc are being taped all day long, same as intersections, public transport systems etc. But hotel rooms? Am I not paying for my privacy ? Previously I thought that only celebrities are being videotaped but the author Bohdan O. Szuprowicz provides enough links to Google and YouTube to convince me that everybody is being spied on, constantly. I am too overwhelmed to really state what I am going to do with this information, but I can say for certain that this book should be read by everybody. Of course Mr. Orwell guessed all of this a long time ago. A short but incredibly important book. Biography: Bohdan O. Szuprowicz founded the 21st Century Research consultancy and collaborated with Chase Manhattan Bank in setting up a market research operation to evaluate opportunities in China, the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe. He traveled frequently to those areas and crossed Checkpoint Charlie to East Berlin on several occasions. He also toured South Africa to observe apartheid environments and met with independence fighters in Namibia. His work on network planning earned him an invitation to present it at the International Symposium on Operations Research for Developing Countries in Paris.As a result of his experiences and research into geopolitics, he published Doing Business with Peoples Republic of China and How to Avoid Strategic Materials Shortages with John Wiley & Sons, as well as How to Invest in Strategic Metals with St. Martins Press. He also published Multimedia Networking with McGraw-Hill, which included Japanese and Korean editions and Multimedia Tools for Managers with AMACOM. He collaborated for several years with Computer Technology Research, which published corporate reports on Internet and networking technologies.For several years Szuprowicz was managing editor of several newsletters on Internet technology applications and a columnist for Financial Sentinel, Moneyworld and other magazines. He published Supergrowth Technology USA, an investment newsletter, and consulted with many corporations on technology markets. His current research focus is on Nuclear Terror Geopolitics on a worldwide basis. To see all his published E-Titles and spot an occasional free review copy promotion please click on the link below: http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss_1?url=node%3D154606011&field-keywords=Szuprowicz Szuprowicz also published hundreds of articles in many countries in journals such as Les Affaires, Atlanta Constitution, Australian Financial News, Barrons Weekly, Bull & Bear, Business South Africa, California Business, Canadian Business, China Business Review, Christian Science Monitor, Computerworld, Denver Post, Duns Review, Eurofinance, Financial Post, Investment Dealers Digest, IPO Reporter, Japan Economic Journal, National Investment & Finance of India, Newsday, Newsweek International, New Scientist, Oficinas, Singapore Times, Skrzydlata Polska, Usine Nouvelle, Wall Street Microinvestor, Wall Street Transcript, ZeroUno and many others.He has been a frequent speaker, panelist and moderator at international conventions, symposia and conferences. He holds a BS degree from the Imperial College of Science and Technology of the University of London. He also did postgraduate work in journalism and management at Columbia University in New York and UCLA in California.Szuprowicz is an active member of the British Schools and Universities Club, the Schiehallion Club of Kinloch Rannoch, Republican Club of South Sarasota County, National Rifle Association, Sarasota Fiction Writers, Sarasota Authors Connection, Sarasota Writers Forum, Sarasota Camera Club, Sarasota Technology Users Group (STUG), and was previously a member of the Royal Aeronautical Society.For more information, visit:
